captions.text: They're fast.
They're brutal.
They look harmless.
Wolves in sheep's clothing are monsters
yet they're deceptively understated.
Whether on the autobahn or a closed track,
to wolves in sheep's clothing,
everyone else on the road is easy prey.
You've yearned for them.
You've pleaded for them,

and dreamed of them
at least 1,000 times.
It's time you finally got them.

The new wolves in sheep's clothing.
Let's go!
This time we've got three hot wolves.
They have 1854 horsepower between them,
hidden beneath harmless sheep costumes.
We'll start off with the 1M V8 by TJ Fahrzeugdesign.
The ingredients are easy yet effective:
The BMW 1 Series coupe serves as the foundation.
Carbon and the speedometer hint at what's under the hood:
the solid power of the last-generation M3:
a 4 liter, 8 cylinder naturally aspirated engine.
Only experts could call its bluff.
The 118i never existed as a weak coupe.
The 8 cylinder in the M3 has 414 hp.
How much does the tuned 1 Series have?
Time for a performance test.

Time to get some M-power
up on the rollers.
I wonder if it's really got 414 hp.
The V8 keeps its word.
It has just about 414 hp.
Weighing in at around 3300 pounds, it's power-to-weight ratio
is just about that of a Porsche 911 Carrera.
This is going to be a blast

because this is
a M3 V8 engine with 414 hp,

in the body of a cute
little 1 Series coupe.
Switch off the stability control,
then it's time for some drifting, of course.
The 1M V8 inherited the M3 chassis.
Extended drifts are child's play.
It's a wolf in sheep's clothing,
and a freakin' drift machine.
Incredible!
Matthias is feeling playful.
He's never had this much fun in a 118i.

This engine in this little car
is a magnificent combination,
because the car can handle it.
The front axle is okay.
The rear axle has nice slippage,

but if you don't want that,
you can also drive perfectly.
That's surprises me a bit.

And it's got some killer thrust!
Holy moly!
The tuning kit with M3 engine starts at 20,000 euros,
1 Series foundation not included.
The series is limited to 10 vehicles.
I got to 125 mph on the landing strip,

but I want to know the max speed,
so it's time to hit the autobahn.

And then we can see
if anybody underestimates us,
because it says 118i on the back.
Will the disguise be a success?
He's yet to find any takers.
Let's see what it can do.
Yeah?
That's a wicked feeling.
We're already going 155,
I'll shift into 7th gear.
Now we're at 175.

Crazy!
That sure was fast.
175? No problem.
Its max speed is 190 mph.
We need some takers, people.
What do we have here?
That's a Porsche.
It's a Cayman S.
Hello.
We'll show him the model number.
Now he's reading:
Will he take the bait?
Hi there!
Hello.
Okay.

I have to admit
the Cayman S sort of keeps up,
but not really.
Normally the Porsche would blow the 1 Series away.

They go to the Porsche Zentrum,
get themselves a Cayman S,

then they run into Matthias Malmedie
on the autobahn.

This car definitely earned the title
wolf in sheep's clothing.

But now I'm thirsty
for a bit more power.
Got anything stronger?
Naturally, Matthias.
Let me introduce you to the Cadillac CTS-V,
tuned by Geiger Cars.
Typically American,
the Caddy's 8 cylinder ensures a distinctive sound
which comes from a monstrous cubic capacity of 6.2 liters.
An enlarged compressor and a finely tuned engine
transform this American coupe
into a big bad wolf in sheep's clothing.
So, Cadillac CTS-V.
In the performance test
it had 660 hp.

That's what I'm talking about.
Now it gets interesting.

We were in little league,
so to speak, with 414 hp.
But now we're nearing the 690 mark.
Well then, let's do this.
Dude!

We had mega wheel spin in 2nd gear,
without playing with the clutch.

I played with the clutch in 3rd gear,
and left behind some mega skid marks.
When we started out, the Cadillac had brand new 905 tires.
The tires are nearly warmed up,
then we'll have some real traction.

That powerful acceleration,
and the way the compressor sings!

It feels like
you're traveling in a swarm

of a billion angry bees
buzzing around like crazy.
That's exactly how it sounds, too.

It takes the corners a bit weirdly.
First it understeers.
Then you hit the gas,
and it oversteers something crazy.

The wheels scream
almost as loudly as the compressor.
But this is a wolf sheep's clothing.

So we've got to get on the autobahn,
see how people react,

and see if there's anybody out there
who can keep up.
The American goes from 0 to 124 mph in 12 seconds.
That makes the Cadillac a real speed demon.
But you can't tell by looking at it.
Looks what's coming up behind us!
That's an M3.
With custom paint.
He's got the running lights on.
Let's let him catch up with us.
Will our cover be blown?
Howdy.
Hello.
Look, they've got a full car.
Let's show them what we can do.
Holy moly!

Where'd he go?
I can't see him anymore.
We're already going 170.
He disappeared!
No way!
Dude!
He's just gone.
The M3 is gone.
Who blew the M3 out of the water?
Oh, that was the CTS-V.

I just tapped the gas in 4th,
and he was gone.
The M3 had no chance,
and got pounded into the ground by the Caddy.
Mission accomplished, but the M3 is coming back for more.

Oh, there he is again.
Does he want to try again?

Well?
Okay, then we'll do it again.
He's right behind me. Bye!
5th gear.

The buzzing bees
are buzzing away. 170.
6th gear.
When given enough space,
the Caddy has a max speed of up to 210 mph.
Is it a wolf in sheep's clothing?
Is it a wolf in sheep's clothing?
I say: yes.

Because you see it and think:
Okay, it's an American coupe.

But you'd never expect it
to be as fast as it is.

But we've got one wolf left,
Matthias.
The Audi RS 6
by the Upper Bavarian tuning workshop Hotoru.
The hardcore station wagon is the Bavarians' first project.
With a bi-turbo and 10 cylinders,
a production model Audi RS 6 already has 570 horsepower.
According to Hotoru, it's got a colossal 795 hp.
No other tuner has ever managed to get so much power from this engine.
Is it even possible?
This performance test is the moment of truth.

Man is that wicked!
It's got 783.9 hp.
It didn't quite hit 795,

but that's probably
just the normal margin of error.
Whatever. I have to drive it.
Matthias starts with an acceleration test.
From 0 to...
Well, let's find out.
155. I'm losing it.
That's so easy.
It's just incredible.
It's unbelievable,

and that's something
only a car with 790 hp can do.
It sprinted from 0 to 124
in less than 10 seconds.

Sometimes I get the feeling
I've driven it before.
Its handling reminds me a little...

Don't scream, but it reminds me
of the Bugatti Veyron.

Because it accelerates
so vehemently.
And it's always got traction.
This station wagon is a killer,
and weighs over 2 tons.
That takes its toll in the corners.

Lateral dynamics
aren't its strong suit, to be honest.

That's due to
the huge motor in the front,
and its calibration in general.
It understeers.
It's not very dynamic.
It's not that fun to drive, honestly.
Time for the autobahn.
Come on,
don't you want to know how fast the RS 6 by Hotoru is?

I'm already going 124,
and I'm going to speed up.
Man, it presses you into the seat.
Oh, it downshifted, okay.
We're already going 155.
The RS 6 by Hotoru has a max speed of 225 mph.
Then the engine is electronically limited.
Goodness gracious!
Now it just says 90 mph.
Time for a playmate.
Matthias doesn't have to wait long.

It's a Camaro.
What does it say on the back?
ZL 1. Got it.

He's got the horsepower
we're supposed to have.
Namely 570 hp.

That means that
the driver of that car

might think
they could take a RS 6.

But they can't,
as I'm about to demonstrate.
The Chevy Camaro bit off more than it could chew.
Killer station wagon vs. American muscle car
is a pretty one-sided fight.

The RS 6
is actually a far cry

from being a
wolf in sheep's clothing.
With that fat back side,

everybody sees right away:
Okay, it's got some power.

But nobody would ever guess
that it has this much power.

And that's why
it's a wolf in sheep's clothing.
But which is your favorite wolf, Matthias?
One, two or three?
Time for you to make a decision.
The M3, the 118i, the 1M:

It's a cutie,
a nice drift machine.
The CTS-V is a badass.
A very powerful, very fast badass.

And the Audi RS 6 is a speed
demon for the autobahn.
All three are useful.
AUTO MAGAZINE

comments.author: TrueToFootball

comments.text:
Die früheren Folgen von Wölfe im Schafspelz waren besser. Warum ? Man hat 
sich Mühe beim Tarnen der Autos gegeben z.B. hat man das RS6 Zeichen 
abgedeckt und das Auto Senioren mäßig dekoriert, indem man alte Stroh Hüte 
ans heck Fenster platziert hat. Man hat solche Klebefolien ans Fenster 
geklebt wo drauf stand: Vorsicht Anfänger, Vorsicht Nachwuchs/Baby im Auto 
etc. Dadurch sah das Auto dann auch wirklich durchschnittlich und gut 
getarnt aus. Bei dieser Folge gibt Matthias sich kaum mühe und fährt 
einfach zur Autobahn. Ich finds schade :(﻿
